intro: Calyptranthes bullata, commonly known as the bullata calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy appearance. Calyptranthes bullata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
